Review: Other reviewers have already pointed out many blatant historical inaccuracies. This movie is one of many recent Indian movies that claims to be based on historical events but is based on folklore. The formula is a simple fake narrative: muslims were good for nothing and only won through treachery (for over 600 years lol), hindus were chivalrous but kept losing because of high morals (for over 600 years lollol) , all text book history is biased (just cause it doesn't suit them), and none should question imagined 'facts' because falsifying is for the greater nationalistic good (movie is tax free in some Indian states).What is even more bizarre is how some reviewers are dissatisfied with 7/10 level of falsification and are demanding for 10/10 max pro level fake. Lying to themselves, making a mockery and eroding the trust of their own people.

Review: It's been a while since I had been so frustrated and mindblown on how bad a film was, and to say I felt that level of disappointment with this "period biopic" is an understatement. Filled with awful writing, piss poor performances, and cartoonish action sequences, "Samrat Prithviraj" has nothing to offer. Neither does the film be accurate historically, nor does it make it a lot more entertaining. The background score is bland, Obnoxious and overpresent, and actively takes away from the enjoyment of the film. Yeah it's a period piece, where Prithviraj totally kills someone who actually was alive after even Prithvi' own death!
